verses.verse: And <WG2532> Jesus<WG2424> answered<WG611> and spake<WG2036> again<WG3825> in<WG1722> parables<WG3850> unto them<WG846>, saying<WG3004>,
The kingdom<WG932> of heaven<WG3772> is likened unto<WG3666> a certain<WG444> king<WG935>, who<WG3748> made<WG4160> a marriage<WG1062> feast for<WG5207> his<WG846> son<WG5207>,

and <WG2532> sent forth<WG649> his<WG846> servants<WG1401> to call<WG2564> them that were bidden<WG2564> to<WG1519> the marriage<WG1062> feast<WG2532>: and they would<WG2309> not<WG3756> come<WG2064>.

Again <WG3825> he sent forth<WG649> other<WG243> servants<WG1401>, saying<WG3004>, Tell<WG2036> them that are bidden<WG2564>, Behold<WG2400>, I have made ready<WG2090> my<WG3450> dinner<WG712>; my<WG3450> oxen<WG5022> and<WG2532> my fatlings<WG4619> are killed<WG2380>, and<WG2532> all things<WG3956> are ready<WG2092>: come<WG1205> to<WG1519> the marriage feast<WG1062>.
But <WG1161> they made light of<WG272> it<WG565>, and went their ways, one<WG3588> to<WG1519> his<WG2398> own farm<WG68>, another<WG3588> to<WG1519> his<WG2398> merchandise<WG1711>;
and <WG1161> the rest<WG3062> laid<WG2902> hold on his<WG846> servants<WG1401>, and<WG2532> treated them shamefully<WG5195>, and<WG2532> killed them<WG615>.

But <WG1161> the<WG191> king<WG935> was wroth<WG3710>; and<WG2532> he sent<WG3992> his<WG846> armies<WG4753>, and<WG2532> destroyed<WG622> those<WG1565> murderers<WG5406>, and<WG2532> burned<WG1714> their<WG846> city<WG4172>.
Then <WG5119> saith he<WG3004> to<WG1401> his<WG846> servants<WG3303>, The wedding<WG1062> is<WG2076> ready<WG2092>, but<WG1161> they that were bidden<WG2564> were<WG2258> not<WG3756> worthy<WG514>.

Go ye<WG4198> therefore<WG3767> unto<WG1909> the<WG1327> partings of the highways<WG3598>, and<WG2532> as many<WG3745> as<WG302> ye shall find<WG2147>, bid<WG2564> to<WG1519> the marriage feast<WG1062>.

And <WG2532> those<WG1565> servants<WG1401> went out<WG1831> into<WG1519> the highways<WG3598>, and gathered together<WG4863> all<WG3956> as many as<WG3745> they found<WG2147>, both<WG5037> bad<WG4190> and<WG2532> good<WG18>: and<WG2532> the wedding<WG1062> was filled<WG4130> with guests<WG345>.

But <WG1161> when<WG1525> the king<WG935> came in<WG1525> to behold<WG2300> the guests<WG345>, he saw<WG1492> there<WG1563> a man<WG444> who had<WG1746> not<WG3756> on<WG1746> a wedding<WG1062>- garment<WG1062>:

and <WG2532> he saith<WG3004> unto him<WG846>, Friend<WG2083>, how<WG4459> camest thou in<WG1525> hither<WG5602> not<WG3361> having<WG2192> a<WG1742> wedding<WG1062>- garment<WG1742>? And<WG1161> he was speechless<WG5392>.

Then <WG5119> the king<WG935> said<WG2036> to the servants<WG1249>, Bind<WG1210> him<WG846> hand<WG5495> and<WG2532> foot<WG4228>, and cast<WG1544> him out into<WG1519> the outer<WG1857> darkness<WG4655>; there<WG1563> shall be<WG2071> the weeping<WG2805> and<WG2532> the gnashing<WG1030> of teeth<WG3599>.
For <WG1063> many<WG4183> are<WG1526> called<WG2822>, but<WG1161> few<WG3641> chosen<WG1588>.
Then <WG5119> went<WG4198> the Pharisees<WG5330>, and took<WG2983> counsel<WG4824> how<WG3704> they might ensnare<WG3802> him<WG846> in<WG1722> his talk<WG3056>.

And <WG2532> they send to<WG649> him<WG846> their<WG846> disciples<WG3101>, with<WG3326> the Herodians<WG2265>, saying<WG3004>, Teacher<WG1320>, we know<WG1492> that<WG3754> thou art<WG1488> true<WG227>, and<WG2532> teachest<WG1321> the way<WG3598> of God<WG2316> in<WG1722> truth<WG2532>, and carest<WG3199> not<WG3756> for<WG4012> any<WG3762> one<WG4012>: for thou<WG4671> regardest<WG991> not<WG3756> the person<WG4383> of men<WG444>.
Tell <WG2036> us<WG2254> therefore<WG3767>, What<WG5101> thinkest<WG1380> thou<WG4671>? Is it lawful<WG1832> to give<WG1325> tribute<WG2778> unto Caesar<WG2541>, or<WG2228> not<WG3756>?
But <WG1161> Jesus<WG2424> perceived<WG1097> their<WG846> wickedness<WG4189>, and said<WG2036>, Why<WG5101> make ye<WG3985> trial of me<WG3165>, ye hypocrites<WG5273>?
Show <WG1925> me<WG3427> the tribute<WG2778> money<WG3546>. And<WG1161> they brought<WG4374> unto him<WG846> a denarius<WG1220>.
And <WG2532> he saith<WG3004> unto them<WG846>, Whose<WG5101> is this<WG3778> image<WG1504> and<WG2532> superscription<WG1923>?

They say<WG3004> unto him<WG846>, Caesar<WG2541>'s. Then<WG5119> saith he<WG3004> unto them<WG846>, Render<WG591> therefore<WG3767> unto Caesar<WG2541> the things that are Caesar<WG2541>'s; and<WG2532> unto God<WG2316> the things that are God<WG2316>'s.
And when<WG2532> they heard<WG191> it<WG2296>, they marvelled, and<WG2532> left<WG863> him<WG846>, and went away<WG565>.

On <WG2250> that<WG1565> day<WG2250> there came<WG4334> to him<WG846> Sadducees<WG4523>, they that say that<WG3004> there is<WG1511> no<WG3361> resurrection<WG386>: and<WG2532> they asked<WG1905> him<WG846>,

saying <WG3004>, Teacher<WG1320>, Moses<WG3475> said<WG2036>, If<WG1437> a man<WG5100> die<WG599>, having<WG2192> no<WG3361> children<WG5043>, his<WG846> brother<WG80> shall marry<WG1918> his<WG846> wife<WG1135>, and<WG2532> raise up<WG450> seed<WG4690> unto<WG80> his<WG846> brother<WG80>.

Now <WG1161> there were<WG2258> with<WG3844> us<WG2254> seven<WG2033> brethren<WG80>: and<WG2532> the first<WG4413> married<WG1060> and deceased<WG5053>, and<WG2532> having<WG2192> no<WG3361> seed<WG4690> left<WG863> his<WG846> wife<WG1060> unto<WG80> his<WG846> brother<WG80>;
in like manner<WG3668> the second<WG1208> also<WG2532>, and<WG2532> the third<WG5154>, unto<WG2193> the seventh<WG2033>.
And <WG1161> after<WG5305> them all<WG3956>, the woman<WG1135> died<WG599>.
In <WG1722> the resurrection<WG386> therefore<WG3767> whose<WG5101> wife<WG1135> shall she be<WG2071> of the seven<WG2033>? for<WG1063> they<WG2192> all<WG3956> had<WG2192> her<WG846>.
But Jesus<WG2424> answered<WG611> and said<WG2036> unto them<WG846>, Ye do err<WG4105>, not<WG3361> knowing<WG1492> the scriptures<WG1124>, nor<WG3366> the power<WG1411> of God<WG2316>.

For <WG1063> in<WG1722> the resurrection<WG386> they<WG1060> neither<WG3777> marry<WG1060>, nor<WG3777> are given in marriage<WG1547>, but<WG235> are<WG1526> as<WG5613> angels<WG32> in<WG1722> heaven<WG3772>.

But <WG1161> as touching<WG4012> the resurrection<WG386> of the dead<WG3498>, have ye<WG314> not<WG3756> read<WG314> that which was spoken<WG4483> unto you<WG5213> by<WG5259> God<WG2316>, saying<WG3004>,

I <WG1473> am<WG1510> the God<WG2316> of Abraham<WG11>, and<WG2532> the God<WG2316> of Isaac<WG2464>, and<WG2532> the God<WG2316> of Jacob<WG2384>? God<WG2316> is<WG2076> not<WG3756> the God<WG2316> of the dead<WG3498>, but<WG235> of the living<WG2198>.
And <WG2532> when<WG191> the multitudes<WG3793> heard<WG191> it<WG1605>, they were astonished at<WG1909> his<WG846> teaching<WG1322>.
But <WG1161> the Pharisees<WG5330>, when<WG191> they heard<WG191> that<WG3754> he had put<WG5392> the Sadducees<WG4523> to silence<WG5392>, gathered<WG4863> themselves together<WG846>.
And <WG2532> one<WG1520> of<WG1537> them<WG846>, a lawyer<WG3544>, asked<WG1905> him<WG846> a question<WG3985>, trying him<WG846>:
Teacher <WG1320>, which<WG4169> is the<WG1785> great<WG3173> commandment<WG1785> in<WG1722> the law<WG3551>?

And he<WG2424> said<WG2036> unto him<WG846>, Thou shalt love<WG25> the Lord<WG2962> thy<WG4675> God<WG2316> with<WG1722> all<WG3650> thy<WG4675> heart<WG2588>, and<WG2532> with<WG1722> all<WG3650> thy<WG4675> soul<WG5590>, and<WG2532> with<WG1722> all<WG3650> thy<WG4675> mind<WG1271>.
This <WG3778> is<WG2076> the great<WG3173> and<WG2532> first<WG4413> commandment<WG1785>.
And <WG1161> a second<WG1208> like<WG3664> unto it<WG3778> is this<WG25>, Thou shalt love thy<WG4675> neighbor<WG4139> as<WG5613> thyself<WG4572>.
On <WG1722> these<WG3778> two<WG1417> commandments<WG1785> the whole<WG3650> law<WG3551> hangeth<WG2910>, and<WG2532> the prophets<WG4396>.
Now while<WG1161> the Pharisees<WG5330> were gathered together<WG4863>, Jesus<WG2424> asked<WG1905> them a question<WG846>,
saying <WG3004>, What<WG5101> think<WG1380> ye<WG5213> of<WG4012> the Christ<WG5547>? whose<WG5101> son<WG5207> is he<WG2076>? They say<WG3004> unto him<WG846>, The son of David<WG1138>.
He saith<WG3004> unto them<WG846>, How<WG4459> then<WG3767> doth<WG2564> David<WG1138> in<WG1722> the Spirit<WG4151> call<WG2564> him<WG846> Lord<WG2962>, saying<WG3004>,

The Lord<WG2962> said<WG2036> unto<WG2962> my<WG3450> Lord<WG2962>, Sit thou<WG2521> on<WG1537> my<WG3450> right hand<WG1188>, Till<WG2193> I<WG302> put<WG5087> thine<WG4675> enemies<WG2190> underneath<WG4228> thy feet<WG4675>?
If <WG1487> David<WG1138> then<WG3767> calleth<WG2564> him<WG846> Lord<WG2962>, how<WG4459> is he<WG2076> his<WG846> son<WG5207>?

And <WG2532> no one<WG3762> was able<WG1410> to answer<WG611> him<WG846> a word<WG3056>, neither<WG3761> durst<WG5111> any<WG5100> man from<WG575> that<WG1565> day<WG2250> forth<WG575> ask<WG1905> him<WG846> any more questions<WG3765>.
